snippet: The lawyer for Sulaiman Abu Ghaith cited recent revelations about the government’s logging of domestic phone calls.
abstract: Lawyer for Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, son-in-law to Osama bin Laden who is awaiting trial in Manhattan on charge of conspiring to kill Americans, asks federal judge to bar government from any kind of monitoring of defense's phone calls, e-mail or other communications; files court papers stating that such electronic surveillance permits government to learn privileged information to which it has no legal right.
lead_paragraph: The lawyer for Sulaiman Abu Ghaith cited recent revelations about the government’s logging of domestic phone calls.

headline.main: Lawyer Seeks Confidentiality for a Relative of Bin Laden
headline.print_headline: Lawyer Seeks Confidentiality For a Relative of Bin Laden
